result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory J Borgwardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalty - Theft >$5000-$10,000], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalty - Theft >$5000-$10,000], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary, plus statutorily authorized surcharges. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay costs of the action.  Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. No contact direct or indirect with victims.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant Cory J Borgwardt in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Defendant Cory J Borgwardt in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Parties are not requesting PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.
or transport defendant for court on 8/20/15.
